title: Statistic or Parameter
question_text:
Mr. Jones works in a large high school and wants to determine the average grade of all the biology students. Mr. Jones found the average grade in his biology class ($n = 30$) was $80.2$. This compares to the school-wide average of $77.3$.
Which of the value is a statistic and which is a parameter?

choices.text: Parameter: $80.2$; $77.3$ is neither a statistic nor a parameter.

solution:
A statistic describes a sample, while parameter describes the population.

For example, if I sample 100 random people in the United States and find that 46% plan to vote Republican in the next election, the value
46
100
=0.46 is a statistic.

The unknown percentage who actually do vote Republican on election day is a parameter because this value describes the population. Note, the population is defined as who we want information about.

In this particular problem, Mr. Jones's class of size n=30
is a sample, and ALL students who take biology at the school is the population. Therefore, the score of 80.2
is a statistic since it describes the sample, while the score of 77.3
is a parameter because it describes the population.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
